Dead by Daylight is very entertaining. This is the type of game that you could commit a few minutes to and be on your way; This is the type of game you could play for hours on end. You can even play as some of the classic movie killers! This is more than just the typical survival game, see for yourself!

Что скажу? Игра без сомнений бомба, однако желательно играть с друзьями т.к. понимание перков другово человека очень важно в онлайн играх. Возьмем перки дуайта. Его перки позволяют ускорить почти любую работу, включая починку генераторов и лечение. НО для активации этих перков ему нужно сплотится с другими членами команды, что многие не понимают потому что не играли за дуайта, что посчитали это слишком скучным. Одна цель из любой игры: опробовать каждого персонажа на вкус.

Игра своих денег стоит даже с учетом токсичности игроков и наличия читеров. Если просто играть ради фана, как одному, так в пати – можно творить грязь в хорошем смысле слова и получать удовольствие даже под пивас. Встречаются конечно задроты и остается вопрос зачем. Эта игра не станет никогда киберспортивной линейкой. В ней много дисбаланса и недоработок, начиная про незачет хит бокса урона или оглушения, когда оно не должно было проходить на таком расстоянии (кто играл, тот поймет). Одним словом многопользовательская игра просто почилить и убить свободное время.

A few things to consider before buying this game, 1. If you get easily upset or angry, think hard, this game is rough. It will try you patients in every way, the players can be toxic, there is a reason the term "survivor entitlement" gets thrown around with this game. However it works both ways, killers can and will be toxic just as much. 2. If you cannot work well with a team, especially if you cannot talk to them, survivor will be a bummer time. 3. If you do not like extreme counter play e.g. a killer perk called "No One Escapes Death" which, in endgame, the killer can put you into the dying state in one hit, which can feel very unfair, this game has many such perks for both killer and survivor. 4. This game has many people who passionately play, and have played for long enough (myself included), these players will just be playing for their own fun and enjoyment, even at the cost of doing some very questionable decisions e.g. basement bubba (look it up, seriously) 5. Many people will tunnel and will intentionally try to get chased, if that upsets you, take a step back. HOWEVER! This game also has a LOT of great players and if you like a challenge, this game has a crazy learning curve. Many many perks to change the way you play, and many characters with unique perks and powers. If you like a large roster of characters as well as many ways to customize, in this case cosmetics for both survivors and killers. This game is also great for always getting changes, perk buffs/nerfs, killer power changes, new game mechanics such as the recent addition of Boon Totems. If you are a patient player, who enjoys games in which no two games will be quite the same, I CANNOT recommend this game enough. I have put over 800 hours into this game and I still have yet to unlock all survivor and killer perks. I am still learning how to loop killers and how to counter loop survivors. To sum it up, this game is WELL worth the price, especially when you don't need to buy the dlc to unlock the survivors or killers, you can purchase them with the in game currency, "iridescent shards". I hope this helps anyone still thinking about playing this game, and I hope to see you all in the fog! GG!

The game can still be considered to be fun, custom games are always fun to practice in with friends as well. Toxicity of course still exists when it comes to the competitive scene of the game but that doesn't change for every online game out there, sweaty tryhards will always continue to be. If you're having fun with your own performance of the game then that's more dominion for you, however the game still has potential to do way more then having the same gamemode, only slight differences are a small boost from perks and the powers the killers behold. There's many other strategies out there, if you've spent a good chunk of time playing this game you'll soon enough realize to not expect long term happiness with the game.

You can also be a good sport and try to have fun with the survivors as killer, farming bloodpoints or challenges as you take a stab at the environment around you. This way you can gain their trust and you can all mess around and farm your objectives in order to upgrade your characters. Same thing as survivor but you have to put an effort in making friendly gestures in an attempt to gain the trust of the killer. The perspective changes from there and then, the whole aspect has been changed without much sweat getting to your head.

Oh also I wouldn't blame the devs entirely but something seems to be happening with the game and it's game breaking bugs and many sorts of glitches. Only thing left to blame is your performance if you really want to win and the management team of the game.
